snippet: The Rhode Island agreement to end the economic servitude of developmentally disabled people is a promising, and overdue, starting point.
abstract: Editorial applauds comprehensive agreement between Rhode Island and Justice Department to help developmentally disabled residents obtain community-based jobs and job training; decries widespread exploitation and abuse of such people that occurs in absence of such programs; holds deal could serve as model for treatment of nation's 450,000 developmentally disabled citizens.
lead_paragraph: The Rhode Island agreement to end the economic servitude of developmentally disabled people is a promising, and overdue, starting point.
